intro: Gnaphalium mandonii, commonly known as the desert everlasting, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. It is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats. Gnaphalium mandonii is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
